job description:

We’ve been dedicated to protecting the environment since our invention of the electric thermostat in 1885, which provided a fundamental shift in the energy efficiency of buildings. Now, all over the world, our products and services empower customers and communities to consume less energy and conserve resources.

  • Global, innovative, industry leader
  • #70 on Fortune’s most admired companies list
  • Embraces diversity
  • Growth opportunities abound
  • Fast paced, evolving company, always learning, always adapting
  • Great benefits; including Healthcare related wellness discounts, great 401k match, company funded retirement program, vacation, sick time, floating holidays and national holidays
What you will do

The IT Asset Management Analyst II will work at the direction of the Global Infrastructure Asset Management leadership to support operations, processes and procedures that are core to Hardware Asset Management best practices, including effective lifecycle management of all specified assets. This position will utilize Hardware Asset Management tools and methodologies to maintain the accuracy and automation of reporting and asset tracking to ensure the maintenance of assets entered within the tool and/or all associated records throughout the lifecycles of the asset.

IT Asset Management (ITAM) enables key corporate priorities by controlling costs, enhancing operational efficiency, ensuring regulatory compliance, and mitigating security & financial risks. Work as a member of the IT Asset Management team, primarily supporting the Hardware Asset Management function

How you will do it

The Hardware Asset Management Analyst should have the demonstrated ability to analyze, research, resolve questions and/or concerns, and possess the ability to learn quickly and adjust to technology changes. A proficiency in system management and back office processes is preferred. Individual must communicate clearly, diplomatically and effectively at all levels of the organization and to audiences with varying degrees of process and technical knowledge.

  • Track and manage IT assets throughout their life cycle, ensuring logical and consistent operational processes are defined and standard systems are implemented to acquire and maintain IT assets in a CMDB
  • Ensure accurate and complete asset information is available to supply financial reporting
  • Enhance business decision-making
  • Improve time-to-market and manage supply chain issues with hardware supplier
  • Manage asset-related liabilities and risks
  • Improve customer service and responsiveness
  • Establish a foundation for services including Information Security
  • Inventory Management
  • Problem Management
  • Compliance Management
  • Execute policy and process in support of ITAM program goals
  • Manage and improve the hardware lifecycle process, from receiving to disposal
  • Improve the quality of hardware data in the IT asset repository
  • Assist in providing key analytical reporting
  • Support senior team members in projects and audits
  • Service enterprise customers by responding to hardware asset requests
  • Assist the IT Asset and Data Manager with audits and report generation.
  • Maintain the configuration management database for accuracy and consistency.
  • Ensures the CMDB is updated upon successful change implementation.
  • Collect and retain asset data for risk and cost assessment.

What we look for
  • Undergraduate degree in Business, Technology, or related major with a background or interest in Information Technology required
  • 5 years’ of experience in an analytical role; experience working with IT hardware highly preferred
  • Proficiency in MS Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint
  • Proficiency in ITIL best practices
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Detail-oriented, proactive, and highly organized
  • Capable of prioritizing work and multi-tasking
  • Takes initiative and able to work independently
  • Strong written and oral communication skills

Additional requirements include:

  • A bachelor’s degree in a technical field or a minimum of 3 years of asset configuration management experience
  • ServiceNow training and certification and Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) Certification required within 2 years of being hired
  • Detail oriented and possess excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical and organizational skills

We are passionate about improving the way the world lives, works and plays. The future requires bold ideas, an entrepreneurial mind-set and collaboration across boundaries. You need a career focused on tomorrow. Tomorrow needs you.
